bug.author: kierenj
bug.summary: build_image_from_working_dir / func_to_container_op: No matching credentials were found, falling back on anonymous
bug.description:
/kind bug I'm getting an error when running some pipeline-building code in a notebook running on a kubeflow cluster I set up last Oct. It's run OK in the past. Update: It worked again once, and then it's failed 3 times in a row. It's still intermittent, but with a lower chance of success.. What steps did you take and what happened: <denchmark-code>image = kfp.containers.build_image_from_working_dir( base_image='tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3', image_name='eu.gcr.io/my-project/my-image:latest', file_filter_re=r'.*\.ipynb', timeout=3*60*60 # 3 hours )
my_func_op = kfp.components.func_to_container_op( func=my_func, base_image=image ) </denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>INFO[0000] Resolved base name tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 to tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 INFO[0000] Resolved base name tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 to tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 INFO[0000] Downloading base image tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 ERROR: logging before flag.Parse: E0112 09:36:12.073198 1 metadata.go:142] while reading 'google-dockercfg' metadata: http status code: 404 while fetching url http://metadata.google.internal./computeMetadata/v1/instance/attributes/google-dockercfg ERROR: logging before flag.Parse: E0112 09:36:12.076661 1 metadata.go:159] while reading 'google-dockercfg-url' metadata: http status code: 404 while fetching url http://metadata.google.internal./computeMetadata/v1/instance/attributes/google-dockercfg-url 2020/01/12 09:36:12 No matching credentials were found, falling back on anonymous INFO[0001] Error while retrieving image from cache: getting file info: stat /cache/sha256:14ec674cefd622aa9d45f07485500da254acaf8adfef80bd0f279db03c735689: no such file or directory INFO[0001] Downloading base image tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 2020/01/12 09:36:13 No matching credentials were found, falling back on anonymous INFO[0002] Built cross stage deps: map[] INFO[0002] Downloading base image tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 2020/01/12 09:36:13 No matching credentials were found, falling back on anonymous INFO[0002] Error while retrieving image from cache: getting file info: stat /cache/sha256:14ec674cefd622aa9d45f07485500da254acaf8adfef80bd0f279db03c735689: no such file or directory INFO[0002] Downloading base image tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3 2020/01/12 09:36:14 No matching credentials were found, falling back on anonymous INFO[0003] Using files from context: [/kaniko/buildcontext/requirements.txt] INFO[0003] Checking for cached layer eu.gcr.io/xx/yy/cache:09612b40401999e8179ad6c6fd545d579b2213c3274fb5464559fe231939735f... INFO[0003] Using caching version of cmd: RUN python3 -m pip install -r requirements.txt INFO[0003] Using files from context: [/kaniko/buildcontext] INFO[0003] Skipping unpacking as no commands require it. INFO[0003] Taking snapshot of full filesystem... INFO[0003] WORKDIR /python_env INFO[0003] cmd: workdir INFO[0003] Changed working directory to /python_env INFO[0003] Creating directory /python_env INFO[0003] Taking snapshot of files... INFO[0003] Using files from context: [/kaniko/buildcontext/requirements.txt] INFO[0003] COPY requirements.txt . INFO[0003] Taking snapshot of files... INFO[0003] RUN python3 -m pip install -r requirements.txt INFO[0003] Found cached layer, extracting to filesystem INFO[0015] Taking snapshot of files... INFO[0029] Using files from context: [/kaniko/buildcontext] INFO[0029] COPY . . INFO[0029] Taking snapshot of files... 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:8592f093fc78e0d933851ed625592627241c475dd46adad77f37dec9cc867446 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:e52cad4ccd832fc331516c5a5632fdd08c37d711ff243c7e04d6e8c374b9c474 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:e97116da5f9876a95d0d3f0fd1e3bcc48721f9ac6351ce23aaa3d261b4f9b0d6 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:75c61371a2e390c1d05234b28163580c90c2e26c6d245984a4da73f9f022c102 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:107f0b841886b4e032a6ced874db81b71dcdc5e6827b6c0d195defe4c6e661da 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:edc69fe5c6be6938f490e5f91cdb6369799b4a509fd72c292e0cd6fdb3c345b3 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:2746a4a261c9e18bfd7ff0429c18fd7522acc14fa4c7ec8ab37ba5ebaadbc584 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:c8e37668deea784f47c8726d934adc12b8d20a2b1c50b0b0c18cb62771cd3684 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:0d3160e1d0de4061b5b32ee09af687b898921d36ed9556df5910ddc3104449cd 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:dccb0709d7fb37e513a933c3848be077f0e514e41a084bd9f3f27dcde169ae20 2020/01/12 09:36:41 existing blob: sha256:4c1d20cdee96111c8acf1858b62655a37ce81ae48648993542b7ac363ac5c0e5 error pushing image: failed to push to destination eu.gcr.io/my-project/my-image:latest: DENIED: Access denied. </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: Everything to succeed, as it always has with identical code in the past, and did around 30 minutes ago. Anything else you would like to add: With no code, config or environment changes, this has been working fine for a few months. This last week it started working only intermittently. Now, I can't get it to run at all. As an aside, I'd like to upgrade to the latest version. I used some web UI to install, but the upgrade guide refers to kfctl. If I installed via UI, can I still grab kfctl to upgrade? I would create a new deployment of KF from scratch, but after using the UI, I had to go in and edit a few different settings to work around auth problems, run some command-line bits to get autoscaling node types or settings correct - I didn't keep track of all of that. What would you recommend? Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 812ca7f (kubeflow/pipelines@812ca7f)
Note.. when I open the menu, I get a "build menu". Are these instructions looking to refer to that? In which case, 0.6.2.
kfctl version: (use kfctl version): Not sure where to run this. Opened a terminal on the notebook server: /bin/sh: 1: kfctl: not found Kubernetes platform: GCP Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.12.10-gke.17 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): My laptop? Win10 64-bit. No code running here though.
